text: Primer sequences Primary description Enzyme site antigen, the amount of colloidal gold-labelled antigen on the conjugate pad, the characteristics of the materials used, the buffer systems, the additives, and the solvents applied to ensure that the assays ran successfully over the concentration range required (Table II) . (Table IV) . All antigens ran against negative samples did not show any signs of reactivity in comparison to the control test strip (Fig. 4) . This indicated that the HCV antigen did not cross-react with other common viral antibodies and thus, was highly specific to HCV.
